to change/to alter/to transform/to correct

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Third, the joint reading of Jones writing changed, but so.
sentences.chinese: 第三，联读悟写，改换门庭。

sentences.english: Users are simply satisfied with the search results they are getting right now and don't see the need to switch.
sentences.chinese: 用户对搜索结果十分满意，觉得没有改换门庭的必要。

sentences.english: This company changes after half an year door front courtyard lands American OTCBB market.
sentences.chinese: 半年后该公司改换门庭并登陆美国OTCBB市场。

sentences.english: Because he's not receiving attention, he plans to switch allegiance to a new master.
sentences.chinese: 因为不受重视，他打算改换门庭，另投他人。

to go over to the enemy/to defect
